Iran-Israel: 10 key moments to understand the 12-day conflict
description: From the launch of Israel's offensive in the night between June 12 and 13 to the ceasefire on June 24, Le Monde looks back at the lightning war between the two powers.

headline: Iran-Israel: French PM Bayrou acknowledges a 'shift' to a world where 'force prevails'

Supreme Leader Khamenei says Trump 'exaggerated' impact of US strikes on Iran's nuclear sites
description: On Thursday, Iran's Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei hailed the country's 'victory' after the ceasefire with Israel, and once again threatened US bases in the Middle East, in case of further attacks.

headline: Anna Wintour steps down as editor of US Vogue
description: Wintour is now seeking a replacement after nearly four decades in the role. She is not leaving parent company Conde Nast altogether, however.

headline: 'To topple the Bayrou government today is to risk making France ungovernable'
description: The idea of breaking with the status quo is gaining traction in France, but it is balanced by concerns over the chaos that a no-confidence vote would lead to, writes Le Monde columnist Françoise Fressoz.

headline: Has the Mendelssohn Stradivarius, stolen by the Nazis, been found?
description: An investigation by an American academic asserts the 'Small Mendelssohn,' an exceptional violin taken from the Mendelssohn family during World War II, is the same instrument as the 'Stella,' the magnificent violin currently played by Japanese virtuoso Eijin Nimura. He denies that.

description: By bombing Iran alongside Israel, Donald Trump has performed a show of force aimed at China and Russia, explains the director of the French Institute of International Relations in an interview.

headline: 'Dating apps have every interest to turn our love lives into gruyère cheese, full of holes and short-lived misfires'
description: In an interview with Le Monde, Arnaud Poissonnier, author of a book examining the love industry, advocates for regulating the sector through a professional association and calls on platforms to 'completely rethink their systems.'

headline: Robert Malley: 'The adversaries of the Islamic Republic of Iran would be wrong to celebrate too much'
description: Israel's recent military offensives in Gaza, the West Bank, Lebanon and, together with the US, in Iran, will fuel hatred of the West and a desire for revenge across the Middle East, writes Robert Malley, the lead negotiator of the 2015 Iranian nuclear deal.
